clinical_study.official_title: Measuring the Effectiveness and Utility of Colonic Irrigation for Bowel Preparation in Patients Undergoing Screening or Surveillance Colonoscopy

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this physician blinded, randomized study is to determine the utility, effectiveness, and feasibility of using colonic irrigation as a substitute for standard oral colonic purgative solutions for colonoscopy preparation. Patients will be randomized to receive either oral isosmotic solution (PEG) or colonic irrigation using the Hydro San Plus Colon therapy system, an FDA approved and isosmotic (ISO) certified device for colonic irrigation and cleansing before endoscopic procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Boston Bowel Prep Score (BBPS)
primary_outcome.description: Quality of bowel preparations validated by numerical scale for bowel cleanse (0-9 best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the number of follow ups needed after colonoscopy
Difference in overall comfort and convenience between Colonic Hydrotherapy and Isosmotic Irrigation using Boston Bowel Preparation Score (BBPS)
preferences regarding type of bowel prep for future colonoscopy based on difference in score between Colonic Hydrotherapy and Isosmotic Irrigation using Boston Bowel Preparation Score (BBPS)

arm_group.description: Isosmotic solution ingested prior to colonoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Consecutive adult patients (>18 years old) who require screening or surveillance colonoscopy
- Ability to give consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to obtain informed consent
- Pregnant patients
- Patients under the age of 18
- Active ulcerative colitis or crohn's disease flare
- Prisoners
